inclusion.criterion: New histologically diagnosed breast ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Low risks of BRCA (breast cancer)1 and BRCA2: Manchester Score < 10
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The DCIS must be detected by mammogram and must be unicentric, and no-mass lesion
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Pathological characteristics (all characteristics) 7.1 Lesions ≤ 2.5 cm in greatest dimension on pathologic specimen
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: 7.2 Must be classified as low or intermediate nuclear grade DCIS but without comedo necrosis according to Pathologic Guidelines (section 9.2.2)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: 7.3 Margins as assessed by the ink method will be 3 mm or greater
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: 7.4 Must be estrogen receptor (ER)-positive DCIS, ER percentage must be ≥10%
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Women whose DCIS is palpable at the time of diagnosis, or multi-centric (mammography), or mass (mammography), or who have bloody nipple discharge.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Pathological characteristics 4.1 Lesions measuring greater than 2.5 cm in greatest dimension on pathologic specimen
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: 4.2.High-grade lesions or low to intermediate grade with comedo necrosis as classified by the Guidelines.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: 4.3. Margins as assessed by the ink method will be less than 3 mm
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: 4.4. ER-negative DCIS or ER-positive percentage < 10% in tumor cells
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 42 year-old postmenopausal woman who had a screening sonogram which revealed an abnormality in the right breast. She had no palpable masses on breast exam.
